The Canadian Depository for Securities Limited (CDS) is...

Canada's national securities depository, clearing and settlement hub, holding nearly $2 trillion on deposit, settling between $100 and $200 billion daily and handling up to 57 million securities trades annually for banks, brokers, trust companies and other financial industry members
A gateway to the U.S. and other international securities markets
A provider of a growing range of other securities information and processing services meeting ever-changing market demands (e.g., SEDAR®, ATONTM)
A 500-employee company working for more than 30 years to continuously improve the efficiency, effectiveness, and global competitiveness of Canada's capital markets.


CDS' recruiting objective is to identify and acquire the best qualified candidates available to fill job vacancies.


DESCRIPTION:

Purpose of Job

We require a key resource to control and manage all configuration issues for E-REG. This individual will introduce and enforce industry-standard software configuration management practices including system administration, change control and development methodologies. This individual will also be required to educate the user community about configuration management.


MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:


Schedule, perform and coordinate software configuration management builds

Complete code builds

Perform configuration audits - implement and enforce processes introducing only approved and known code changes into the baseline.

Implement and apply controls, audits, and change and defect management to release builds

Research and implement change management solutions

Administer and manage Code Repository

Administer branching, labeling strategies

Baseline code as required


Administer and manage Defect Reporting System

Report on defects and enhancements included in each release


Manage software configuration of all environments

Provide reports on releases and environments

Maintain internal standards for software configuration management

Investigate and implement version control solutions

Administer and manage version control solution

Apply branching, labeling strategy

Baseline code


Document Configuration Management processes

Document Configuration Management plan

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education

Post Secondary Education in Information Technology is preferred, 5 plus years relevant experience will substitute


Experience

7 - 10 years relevant experience in a development environment, with 5 years configuration management experience is required, including:

Strong working experience with Visual Source Safe

Strong working experience with Rational ClearCase

Working knowledge of ClearQuest or ClearDDTS


Shell scripting or Perl language skills

Strong Unix knowledge. (AIX, Solaris)

Good knowledge of Java (J2EE), and Application Server Technologies. (Websphere/iPlanet)

Good understanding of Web Technologies.



We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in CDS Ltd. Only those applicants selected for interview will be contacted directly.


We regret, no Agency candidate submissions or solicitations for this position.


Please click here to apply directly to CDS Ltd.
Visit our Web-Site.
